title: One year after October 7, festival survivors are healing through action
summary: Of the 1,195 victims of the terrorist attack perpetrated by Hamas in Israel on October 7, 2023, 364 were participants in the Tribe of Nova festival. These survivors have since formed a close-knit community.

title: A weekend of tension between Emmanuel Macron and Benjamin Netanyahu
summary: The French president and the Israeli prime minister had a telephone conversation on Sunday, after tense exchanges linked to Macron's statements calling for a halt to arms deliveries to Israel.

title: Israel strikes Gaza, Lebanon and renews warnings to Iran
summary: Strikes continued in Gaza and Beirut on Sunday as Israel warned Iran from 'taking action.' Tehran announced a mass cancellation of flights from tonight.

title: In France's Marseille, teen 'stabbed 50 times' then burned alive
summary: The teenager had been hired via social networks by a prisoner to intimidate a drug competitor by setting fire to his door, the prosecutor said on Sunday. Marseille, France's second-largest city but also one of its poorest, is plagued by drug-related violence.

title: Tunisia's presidential election sees low turnout
summary: At the time polling stations closed on Sunday, 2.7 million voters − 27.7% of the electorate − had cast ballots. That's far fewer than the 49% who participated in the first round of the last presidential race in 2019.

title: Europe's obsession with immigration
summary: While irregular arrivals have fallen by 39% since the start of 2024, European leaders on both the right and left are not hesitating to borrow ideas that the far right has been advocating for 40 years.

title: One dead and 10 injured in shooting attack in southern Israel
summary: Police said the incident which occurred at the central station in Beer Sheva was being treated as a 'suspected terrorist attack'. The shooting comes just days after a Hamas-claimed shooting attack last week in which seven people were killed in Israel's commercial hub of Tel Aviv.

title: Tunisia's presidential election sees low turnout
summary: At the time polling stations closed on Sunday, 2.7 million voters − 27.7% of the electorate − had cast ballots. That's far fewer than the 49% who participated in the first round of the last presidential race in 2019.

title: Archives reveal the Church considered isolating Abbé Pierre as early as the 1940s
summary: Letters from the Church's national archives reveal that the institution gradually became aware of the 'seriousness' of the acts the famous priest was accused of.

title: 'I want to go home': Ukrainians flee Russia's advance in Donbas
summary: Thousands of people evacuated the city of Pokrovsk and the surrounding area after it was hit by intense fighting. Relocated to temporary shelters in the Dnipro region, these displaced people have had to rebuild everything.

title: Wimereux, the new departure point for people attempting to cross the Channel
summary: In the south of Calais, a small French town is increasingly used as a departure point for would-be asylum seekers determined to reach England.

title: With the handover of the Chagos Islands, the UK cedes part of its colonial past in the Indian Ocean
summary: The Republic of Mauritius had been claiming sovereignty over these islands for over 50 years. The agreement signed by Keir Starmer's government allows the UK to keep the military base it leases to the US army.

title: Macron tells Netanyahu France committed to Israel's security
summary: On the eve of the first anniversary of the October 7 Hamas attack on Israel, French President Emmanuel Macron spoke to the Israeli prime minister by telephone, expressing the 'solidarity' of France with Israel while insisting on a ceasefire.

title: Tunisia polls open as Kais Saied set for re-election
summary: Almost 10 million Tunisians will head to the polls on Sunday for a vote in which experts say incumbent President Kais Saied is poised for victory.

title: Four migrants, including 2-year-old, die trying to cross the Channel
summary: French officials said the accident was not a shipwreck and the dead child had been found in the boat, not in the water.

title: After Ukraine's incursion into Kursk, Kyiv assumes role of occupying army
summary: For the first time since the beginning of the invasion, Ukraine has taken up the position of 'occupier' in this Russian region. The army knows it must remain above reproach if it is not to jeopardize the country's European integration and the support of its allies.

title: Kenya's President William Ruto urges young people to emigrate
summary: Nairobi is negotiating agreements with countries with aging populations, such as Germany and Canada, to send workers there. Experts believe it's both a way to keep a hostile youth away and to bring money into Kenya.

title: Morgan Vanlerberghe, the amateur detective who wants to catch the 'butcher of Mons'
summary: In 2022, Morgan Vanlerberghe published the results of his many years of research into the serial killer who murdered five women in the Belgian Ardennes. Based on this criminology enthusiast's findings, the lawyer for the family of one victim is about to request additional DNA analyses. The results could shed light on the case.

title: What resources does Hezbollah have to counter the Israeli offensive in Lebanon?
summary: Considered the world's leading non-state military power, the pro-Iranian Shiite militia can draw on a vast weapon arsenal and a large, well-trained and well-organized army in view of a new confrontation with Israel.

title: Tunisia's incumbent President Saied set to win presidential election
summary: Kais Saied is set to win the election with 89.2% support despite a low turnout, according to exit polls. Three years after he staged a sweeping power grab, rights groups fear his re-election will only further entrench his rule in the country.

title: 'Tropical' nights, where temperatures don't drop below 20°C, are becoming increasingly common in France
summary: As a direct consequence of climate change, these warm nights are becoming increasingly common in the south, and are steadily spreading further north.

title: In the Cévennes, 'forbidden' American grape varieties are hardier in the face of climate change
summary: In 1934, France banned the selling of vintages made from six grape varieties imported from the US under the appellation of 'wine.' Cévennes winegrowers, who have never stopped cultivating them, are now fighting to rehabilitate these disease- and frost-resistant, water-efficient hybrid varieties.

title: Traveling Israel's Route 232, a year after Hamas's massacre along it
summary: This road, which runs along the Gaza Strip in southern Israel, was used by Hamas during the attack on October 7, 2023. A year later, it has become a linear memorial, lined with makeshift shrines, photos of the missing and QR codes giving visitors information about what happened.

title: How the UK left coal behind for good
summary: The decommissioning of the last remaining power plant makes the country the first G7 member to phase out coal for good.

title: The fish with legs that do more than just walk
summary: Walking, scratching, prey detection: The role and origin of the sea robin's legs, or gurnard, have been revealed by two American teams.

title: Pakistani road explosion kills two Chinese nationals
summary: While local agencies were 'investigating the cause' of the blast, Beijing's embassy described it as a 'terror attack,' while separatist group the Baloch Liberation Army claimed it had targeted 'Chinese engineers and investors.'

title: October 7 commemorations begin around the world
summary: In Israel, Paris, London, Germany, the US, Australia, and Switzerland, ceremonies for the first anniversary of Hamas's attack on Israel began. Meanwhile, protests against the wars in Gaza and Lebanon were also held.

title: October 7: A terrible day, a tragic year
summary: The atrocities committed by Hamas on October 7, 2023, plunged the Israeli-Palestinian conflict into a new, more radical phase. Israel's response soon went beyond self-defense to unrestrained vengeance, destroying Gaza and its population. This violence undermines any chance of reaching a lasting compromise.

title: Filmmaker Frederick Wiseman at the heart of an exceptional French-American retrospective
summary: For the first time, the Centre Pompidou in Paris is offering the complete set of the director's 46 documentaries, and three of his early films are being re-released in theaters.

title: French paleontologists discover new herbivorous dinosaur
summary: Excavations carried out this summer in southwestern France unearthed the remains of a new species of sauropod, a giant herbivore that lived in the region 140 million years ago.

title: The October 7 hostages: A national cause suppressed by Benjamin Netanyahu
summary: The October 7, 2023 massacre resulted in 251 people being taken in one of the largest kidnappings in history. The fate of these hostages, has, over the months, been relegated to the background by the Israeli prime minister.

title: Nobel Prize in medicine honors Victor Ambros and Gary Ruvkun for microRNA discovery
summary: The two Americans discovered microRNA, a fundamental principle governing how gene activity is regulated.

title: French finance minister vows budget will 'fully' adhere to EU rules
summary: Antoine Armand, the recently appointed minister who is due to present the budget on Thursday, said France would 'bring our deficit below the 3% mark by 2029,' two years ahead of his predecessor's promised timeframe.

title: Traveling Israel's Route 232, a year after Hamas's massacre along it
summary: This road, which runs along the Gaza Strip in southern Israel, was used by Hamas during the attack on October 7, 2023. A year later, it has become a memorial lined with makeshift shrines, photos of the missing and QR codes giving visitors information about what happened.

title: After October 7, one year of global upheaval
summary: Hamas's violent attack on October 7, 2023, led to turmoil in Israel, Gaza and around the world.

title: Unanswered questions hang over October 7 in absence of official inquiry, one year on
summary: The October 7 attack highlighted the failings of Israeli intelligence, its military and its political leaders, but the analysis of who can be held responsible is yet to begin.

title: 'October 7 sent us back into survival mode': Divided Israeli society is afraid and confused
summary: Yanay the soldier, Reuven and Avi the kibbutzniks, Dana the party planner and Léah, who works in the theater, have different political views. But they all share the same fears.

title: Omer Bartov, historian: 'Will Israel realize now the limits of its power?'
summary: The obstinacy of Benjamin Netanyahu and his allies, in the war they are waging in Gaza and Lebanon, runs counter to the long-term interests of their country, writes the Israeli historian.

title: Georgia's ruling party renews bid to impeach pro-Western president
summary: President Salomé Zurabishvili has regularly opposed the country's ruling Georgian Dream party, notably after its lawmakers passed a controversial Russian-style 'foreign influence' law in June, triggering massive protests.

title: Parisians share 'a moment of unity' at rally for Israel
summary: Some 50 Jewish organizations gathered in Paris on Sunday to demonstrate their support for Israel and call for the release of the Israeli hostages, one year on from the October 7 Hamas attack.

title: 'Chatbots are like parrots, they repeat without understanding'
summary: Linguist Emily Bender takes a critical stance on the race for large language models to power conversational bots such as ChatGPT.

title: Gaza: How French media have been reporting on a war journalists don't have access to
summary: The impossibility of getting into Gaza, as well as the number of local journalists who have been killed, makes independent reporting extremely challenging – an issue compounded by the explosive nature of the subject.
